name: places/ChIJTTfGM3j1wokRNm9ejl2lkT4
adrFormatAddress: 2326 1st Ave., New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text:
The owner of the shop completely took advantage of us. They agreed to a price and then when we came to pick up the car they did significantly less than what was agreed upon, claiming we did not put it in writing and that there was miscommunication on what they said they would do. We were all fluent in English, he manipulated the conversation to his advantage and charged us far more than necessary, talking circles around us when trying to figure out where the miscommunication happened.

After leaving the shop we ended up getting a flat tire on a four hour road trip we did the next day. We brought the car to a nearby mechanic who then explained that two wheel bolts on a single wheel had completely fallen off and the others still left were able to be removed with their hand, not even using a tire wrench. East River Auto Care had replaced the brake in that same wheel the day before.

We feel lucky to made the journey without totaling the car and now are skeptical of the $1,000+ of other work they did at this auto body shop.

Simply put, go somewhere else. There’s plenty of other options. Do not trust the owner, they will take full advantage of you and not even do a quality job.

originalText.text: Al is a total crook. Went in for an inspection and he told me that I needed new shocks, rotors and brakes before he would pass my car. I left my car overnight and had to pay $25 for "parking" when I wanted my car back after I saw he was ripping me off. This place should not be allowed to do inspections.

text.text: Al is a total crook. Went in for an inspection and he told me that I needed new shocks, rotors and brakes before he would pass my car. I left my car overnight and had to pay $25 for "parking" when I wanted my car back after I saw he was ripping me off. This place should not be allowed to do inspections.

originalText.text: I wouldn’t recommend this place to anybody. I went there for a car inspection. They had me sitting there for almost 20 minutes for something that takes literally 5 to 7 minutes. Every time somebody came in for something more expensive he would have me wait it got up to 30 minutes and then finally I said you know what I’m gonna go to the Bronx where I normally go to get it and they do it really fast. And the owner here does not care about you waiting for something like that. And I watched him walk back and forward and talk to other customers that just pulled up because their cars needed more work that was worth more money then my $37 inspection.

originalText.text: The owner tried to find something to fail my inspection so that I would buy something from his shop.  First it was the tires (they are all less than 8 months old), then he peeled my back windshield wiper (also less than 6 months old) and told me that he can order them for me... no thank you!   Now I have a peeling back windshield wiper.   I want to believe that it was not a gender thing, but the other person who left a one star review had a similar experience.   Stay away or film him when he is conducting the review.

originalText.text:
The owner Ali is a thief & robbing the public with his pricing & lies that he tells you on phone to get you there. Charged me 887.00$ to replace the serpentine belt. A 20 min job. He is POS & will get his one day from a guy that doesn’t care. Read all the reviews below. The city should shut him down immediately!!!!!

Now 2 weeks later my truck breaks down & the belt he installed was done wrong & im in same boat.

Just a scum bag till the end.
